intro: Cadetia foersteriana, commonly known as the Foerster's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Cadetia foersteriana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
